_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The owners, management, and employees of the Farmers Coop Elevator are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Sabetha fire department, and the Brown and Nemaha County LEPC's to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to poeple and the environment.
The primary function at this facility is the storage of agricultural fertilizers for sale to area producers.  Anhydrous Ammonia is received, stored, and distributed as a fertilzier for crop production.  The maximum quantity stored at this location is 271,405 pounds in one storage vessel and 20 nurse tanks.
The worst-case release scenario using Degadis modeling is the release of our largest tanks contents over a ten minute period.  The maximum quantity released would be 183,855 pounds, which represents the volume of the largest tank filled to 85% capacity as limited by safety and design standards.  The distance to endpoint (point of dispersion to 200 ppm) is 2.75 miles using the rural classification.  The alternative release scenario based on a five-year accident history (or the most likely potential incident) is a release from a break in a transfer hose.  The distance to endpoint (point of dispersion to 200 ppm) is.83 miles.
To prevent accidental releases our company is complying with the Kansas Department of Agriculture rules and regulations.
There has not been any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility, nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.
Our facility has a written emergency response plan included with our RMP Compliance Manual.  We have also reported our anhydrous ammonia to the Kansas Department of Heath & Enviroment Right-to-Know program as required.  Additionally, all

employees dealing with anhydrous ammonia at our facility has been trained and tested compentent.
Safety awareness is an ongoing process at our facility.  Maintenance and safety evalulations are performed to assess the facilities condition.
